net.sourceforge.jnipp.project
Class PeerGenSettings

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--net.sourceforge.jnipp.project.PeerGenSettings
public class PeerGenSettings
extends java.lang.Object

Class for manipulating Peer Generator settings. Each instance of this class contains data utilized to specify and query settings controlling the manner in which the C++ Peer Generator is run. Each Project instance contains zero or one PeerGenSettings instance.

Version:
$Revision: 1.15 $
Author:
$Author: ptrewhella $
See Also:
net.sourceforge.jnipp.project.Project#peerGenSettings

public void initialize(org.w3c.dom.Element elementNode)
                throws org.w3c.dom.DOMException,

Public class instance initializer. The initialize() method is called to initialize the settings for this ProxyGenSettings instance using the elements contained in the supplied Element parameter. This method is called from the constructor.

getDOMNode

public org.w3c.dom.Node getDOMNode(org.w3c.dom.Document targetDoc)
Method for retrieving the equivalent DOM node representation of the Peer Generator settings. This method is utilized by the Project class as part of its save() method to serialize the Peer Generator settings, along with all of its child settings.
Parameters:
targetDoc - The target Document instance.
Returns:
The DOM Node representation of the settings.
See Also:
